The post Requiring two-factor authentication on NuGet.org appeared first on The NuGet Blog.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feature]: nuget.org dotnet validation tool" (#9379) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

When you craft a new package, it may take a few attempts before nuget.org accepts it for publishing and the set of validations nuget client uses is not the same nuget.org uses since the client has to support publishing to other feeds potentially with different validation requirements.

### The Elevator Pitch

Have a dotnet tool that would run exactly the same validations as nuget.org, so one could check if nuget.org would accept the package offline. The tool and Gallery have to use shared code, so validations are always kept in sync.

### Additional Context and Details

A subset of validations run by nuget involve checking metadata against information in DB (for example if you can publish package P as user U), so those validations would either have to be absent in the tool or some online interaction has to happen. And if we are OK with online interaction, a validation endpoint could just be exposed by Gallery that would accept packages the same way as upload endpoint but will not publish if validations pass.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "[Feature]: nuget.org dotnet validation tool" (#9379) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: nuget.org dotnet validation tool" (#9379) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

When you craft a new package, it may take a few attempts before nuget.org accepts it for publishing and the set of validations nuget client uses is not the same nuget.org uses since the client has to support publishing to other feeds potentially with different validation requirements.

### The Elevator Pitch

Have a dotnet tool that would run exactly the same validations as nuget.org, so one could check if nuget.org would accept the package offline. The tool and Gallery have to use shared code, so validations are always kept in sync.

### Additional Context and Details

A subset of validations run by nuget involve checking metadata against information in DB (for example if you can publish package P as user U), so those validations either have to be absent in the tool or some online interaction has to happen. And if we are OK with online interaction, a validation endpoint could just be exposed by Gallery that would accept packages the same way as upload endpoint but will not publish if validations pass.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Add new domain for image allowlist " (#9378) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Summary of the changes (in less than 80 characters):

Add domain "caniuse.bitsofco.de" for image allowlist

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9252

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: The search bar disappears when browsing packages under a package owner" (#9377) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

I'm unable to use NuGet.org

### Describe the bug

I remember that there is always a search bar when browsing packages under a package owner, but it disappears recently:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41028779/216486932-d0917271-fbde-4db6-95d8-238be16a6314.png)


### Repro Steps

1. Go to a package owner profile page: https://www.nuget.org/profiles/dotnetframework
2. No search bar any more

### Expected Behavior

The search bar should be there as before when browsing packages under a package owner.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A second search bar blinks when changing the selection of "Sort by"" (#9376) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

When changing the selection of "Sort by", a second search bar is shown and then disappears.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41028779/216483097-ec029bc6-a913-44a1-bf0b-99bff2fbeb75.png)

### Repro Steps

1. Go to the search page in Gallery
2. Change the selection of "Sort by"
3. A second search bar blinks

### Expected Behavior

It should not blink for a better experience.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Search-by-TFM Bug Bash] Box around the TFM section arrows is hidden by the box below it" (#9375) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
The box around the framework generation collapsible arrows (when they're selected/in focus) is distorted by the box below it. Some of the bottom part of the box gets hidden.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "redirect to external privacy link" (#9347) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Privacy page https://www.nuget.org/policies/Privacy redirect to generic Microsoft privacy policy.

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/4669

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Search-by-TFM Bug Bash] Make filters panel collapsible on mobile devices or narrow screens" (#9374) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
The filters panel appears vertically above the search results on mobile devices and narrow screens, and the important search results are pushed to the bottom of the screen, and the user may even have to scroll to get to them, especially when the TFM sections are expanded. The search results should be the most prominent and visible feature on the page when it loads.

### Solution
Make the filters panel collapsible on mobile (and narrow screens). Have the collapsible icon after the 'There are x packages' text, in keeping with current nuget.org. Hide the 'sort by' by default too.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Search-by-TFM Bug Bash] Empty query string parameters should be left out of the url entirely" (#9373) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
Empty query string parameters are included in the url, and the url looks unnecessarily cluttered.

https://dev.nugettest.org/packages?q=&packagetype=&frameworks=&tfms=net472%2Cnet47%2C&prerel=True&sortby=relevance

### Solution
Empty query string parameters should be left out of the url entirely.

https://dev.nugettest.org/packages?tfms=net472%2Cnet47&prerel=True&sortby=relevance

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Search-by-TFM] Users might expect to see computed compatible packages when filtering by TFMs" (#9372) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
People might expect to see computed compatible packages in their search results, rather than just asset frameworks. Package authors use .Net Standard TFMs to be compatible across a range of other frameworks, and their package not showing up as a search result despite being compatible might be a problem.

Eg. People will expect packages targeting netstandard2.0 to show up with most framework selections, since it is compatible with most TFMs, but since we only consider explicit asset TFMs, a user searching for net462 packages will not see compatible netstandard2.0 packages even though they should. 

### Solution
Include computed compatible frameworks in the filtering experience.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Search-by-TFM Bug Bash] packageType param should appear after frameworks and tfms in the url" (#9371) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
The packageType query parameter appears before frameworks and tfms in the url, but appears after them in the UI.

### Solution
The frameworks and tfms params should appear before packageType in the url.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Search-by-TFM Bug Bash] TFM section should be expanded on page load if a TFM is selected" (#9370) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
All TFM sections are collapsed when the page loads, even if a TFM is selected, because of which users can't see their selected TFMs.

### Solution
If any individual TFMs have been selected, their TFM sections should be expanded when the page loads.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Search-by-TFM Bug Bash] Frameworks and tfms params have a trailing comma" (#9369) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
The frameworks and tfms parameters always end in a comma (`net,` ; `net5.0,net472,`).

### Solution
Remove the trailing comma.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Search-by-TFM Bug Bash] Frameworks and tfms params not ordered correctly" (#9368) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
The frameworks and tfms parameters are being added to the query string in the order that the user selects them, rather than the order of the checkboxes in the UI.

### Solution
Frameworks and tfms should appear in the url in the order they appear in the UI.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Search-by-TFM Bug Bash] Prerel parameter uppercase/lowercase inconsistency" (#9367) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
The Prerelease url parameter sometimes has an uppercase boolean ('True') and sometimes a lowercase boolean ('true').

### Solution
It should always show a lowercase boolean.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "FabricBot: fix a condition when switching "waiting for" label" (#12408) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Fix a condition when switching "waiting for" label.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Plan for NuGet in 2023" (#12407) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Today we are excited to share with you the plan for NuGet and NuGet.org. This issue contains summary of the plan for the year and acts as a place for you to leave feedback.

This plan is a collection of input from many stakeholders and outlines where we intend to invest our time in NuGet and NuGet.org.

> **IMPORTANT**
> This plan is not a commitment; it will evolve as we continue to learn throughout the release. Some things that are not currently planned for NuGet may get pulled in. Some things currently planned may even be pushed out.

# General information

NuGet has a major release following [NuGet 6.4](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/release-notes/nuget-6.4) and is currently scheduled for release in November 2023 at the same time as .NET 8.

NuGet will align with the [.NET support policy](https://dotnet.microsoft.com/platform/support/policy/dotnet-core) and will therefore be a long-term support (LTS) release.

NuGet.org does not currently follow any specific schedule and releases features & bug fixes regularly throughout the year.

### Breaking changes

NuGet may contain a small number of breaking changes as we continue to evolve NuGet with the .NET platform. Our goal is to minimize breaking changes as much as possible to keep you productive when upgrading. You'll be able to find them at the [.NET 8 Breaking Changes](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/compatibility/8.0).

## Themes

The large investments in NuGet are the following themes:

### Highly Requested Features

As always, a major input into our planning process comes from [votes (üëç) for features on GitHub](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/blob/dev/CONTRIBUTING.md#before-submitting-an-issue).

These features are areas we are actively engaged in with regards to designing, implementing, and polishing the respective experiences for.

#### Security

- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8087
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/1851
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/11262
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10730
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/12015

#### Tooling

- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/9015

#### Season of Giving

- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/7752
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8476
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8420
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/7912
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/6938
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/6437
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/6279
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/6060
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/5713
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/5556
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/5138
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/4879
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/4855
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/4254
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/4103

#### NuGet Gallery

- https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/3098
- https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8773
- https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8964
- https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9339
- https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7297

### .NET Platforms and Ecosystem

Much of the work planned for NuGet involves improving the package management experience for .NET across different platforms and ecosystem. This involves work in NuGet to ensure a great experience across .NET technologies.

- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10430
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10872
- https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/5154

### Migrating to .NET

NuGet has always [supported many scenarios for package management](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/consume-packages/migrate-packages-config-to-package-reference). In our continued efforts to help you migrate to the latest version of .NET, we will be working on improvements to the [Upgrade Assistant](https://github.com/dotnet/upgrade-assistant) and core package management experiences to help you migrate your project to use the latest version of NuGet.

## Performance

With each [new release of NuGet & Visual Studio comes a plethora of performance improvements](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/performance-improvements-in-nuget/) when restoring NuGet packages, managing project dependencies, and browsing for the next great package to include in your solution. We will continue to invest time to improve your experiences every .NET & Visual Studio release.

# Feedback

Your feedback is important to us. The best way to indicate the importance of an issue is to vote (üëç) for that [issue on GitHub](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues) and [Visual Studio Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/). We use this data to help us with our regular planning so we can work on the things that matter most to you.

Please **comment on this issue** if you believe we are missing something that is critical for NuGet, or are focusing on the wrong areas. Give us a little bit of context as to why you believe so and feel free to upvote each other's comments to help us make changes to our future plans.

Huge thanks to @ajcvickers and the Entity Framework Core team for a wonderful format and forum to discuss product plans in OSS. üéâ

Last year's plan can be found in https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/11571

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Created project.assets.json does not contain all assets" (#12406) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Created project.assets.json does not contain some assets" (#12406) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Nuget package installation with  --interactive option has different flags for IsNonInteractive flag (sdk 7.0.102 vs 7.0.2xx-preview1)" (#12405) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

7.0.102

### Worked before?

Yes, it works in Net 6.0 and in sdk 7.0.2xx-preview1

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

The initial ticket was cleated in templating repo:
https://github.com/dotnet/templating/issues/6020

We were able to repro locally and the only difference in the outputs that influence the result is **IsNonInteractive** values. Please see the attached logs.

From the templating point of view, there is no changes between 7.0.102 and 7.0.2 in [InitializeNuGetCredentialService](https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/blob/bfbcfe92e8df98f04dc5e1a8835b0270176f4b67/src/Cli/Microsoft.TemplateEngine.Cli/TemplatePackageCoordinator.cs#L192-L195:~:text=private%20static%20void-,InitializeNuGetCredentialService(bool%20interactive),-%7B)


### Verbose Logs

```shell
sdk 7.0.102 -> "IsNonInteractive":true

The following template packages will be installed:
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "dotnet add command incorrect behaviou" (#12404) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used dotnet.exe ### Product Version .NET SDK: Version: 7.0.102 Commit: 4bbdd14480 Runtime Environment: OS Name: Windows OS Version: 10.0.25281 OS Platform: Windows RID: win10-x64 Base Path: C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\7.0.102\ Host: Version: 7.0.2 Architecture: x64 Commit: d037e070eb .NET SDKs installed: 7.0.100 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk] 7.0.102 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk] .NET runtimes installed: Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 3.1.31 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App] Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 6.0.11 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App] Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 7.0.0 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App] Microsoft.AspNetCore.App 7.0.2 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.AspNetCore.App] Microsoft.NETCore.App 3.1.31 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App] Microsoft.NETCore.App 6.0.11 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App] Microsoft.NETCore.App 7.0.0 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App] Microsoft.NETCore.App 7.0.2 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App] Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 3.1.31 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App] Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 6.0.11 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App] Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 7.0.0 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App] Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 7.0.2 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App] Other architectures found: x86 [C:\Program Files (x86)\dotnet] registered at [HKLM\SOFTWARE\dotnet\Setup\InstalledVersions\x86\InstallLocation] Environment variables: Not set global.json file: Not found ### Worked before? _No response_ ### Impact None ### Repro Steps & Context ### Describe the bug Incorrect error when adding a package, provided that the project has a link to another project with the same name I took the name `Newtonsoft.Json` as an example In my large project, I did not immediately understand what the problem was, because the error is not very informative. And I didn't find how to enable the detailed log I would like to have an error something like of "Package with 'Newtonsoft.Json' already referenced to this project" or something similar ### To Reproduce 1. Clone [this](https://github.com/0xF6/NuGetBugTest) repo 2. Go to ./NuGetBugTest 3. Execute command dotnet add package Newtonsoft.Json --version 13.0.2 ### Exception:
error: Value cannot be null. (Parameter 'path1') 
  Determining projects to restore...
  Writing C:\Users\ls-mi\AppData\Local\Temp\tmpD16B.tmp
info : X.509 certificate chain validation will use the default trust store selected by .NET.
info : X.509 certificate chain validation will use the default trust store selected by .NET.
info : Adding PackageReference for package 'Newtonsoft.Json' into project 'C:\git\NuGetBugTest\NuGetBugTest\NuGetBugTest.csproj'.
info : Restoring packages for C:\git\NuGetBugTest\NuGetBugTest\NuGetBugTest.csproj...
info : Package 'Newtonsoft.Json' is compatible with all the specified frameworks in project 'C:\git\NuGetBugTest\NuGetBugTest\NuGetBugTest.csproj'.
error: Value cannot be null. (Parameter 'path1')


Usage: NuGet.CommandLine.XPlat.dll package add [options]

Options:
  -h|--help               Show help information
  --force-english-output  Forces the application to run using an invariant, English-based culture.
  --package               Id of the package to be added.
  --version               Version of the package to be added.
  -d|--dg-file            Path to the dependency graph file to be used to restore preview and compatibility check.
  -p|--project            Path to the project file.
  -f|--framework          Frameworks for which the package reference should be added.
  -n|--no-restore         Do not perform restore preview and compatibility check. The added package reference will be unconditional.
  -s|--source             Specifies NuGet package sources to use during the restore.
  --package-directory     Directory to restore packages in.
  --interactive           Allow the command to block and require manual action for operations like authentication.
  --prerelease            Allows prerelease packages to be installed.
### Verbose Logs ```shell dotnet add not use verbose log D: ```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: Static graph restore binlog doesn't have evaluation data" (#11485) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

MSBuild.exe

### Product Version

msbuild 17

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

```
SET RESTORE_TASK_BINLOG_PARAMETERS=LogFile=%cd%\nuget.binlog
msbuild /t:restore /bl /p:RestoreUseStaticGraphEvaluation=true
```

Inspect `nuget.binlog` and notice the Evaluation node is empty/childless:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6445614/148473245-8fd041eb-d414-4ef7-be1a-28ddfabf5d72.png)

It should look more like this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6445614/148473334-b1f82a0a-88e0-4f28-9e89-04b7684f1c6f.png)


### Verbose Logs

_No response_
